:: 2 ::
You are my wife. In consideration of the love I have for you, I have written this settlement deed and given you some immovable property free of charge for the development of your well. The property as per the schedule below is my ancestral property and I am enjoying full possession and rights of the property in the village of Tatipaka, worth Rs. 7,54,000/- in literal terms, seven lakhs and fifty-four thousand rupees. I have written this settlement deed and given you free of charge and without consideration. I have given you possession of the said property on this very day. Therefore, from now on, you shall pay the government and panchayat taxes due on the said property and enjoy it freely and comfortably for the rest of your life, with full possession, donation, and sale rights, for the entire duration of your life. I hereby undertake to remove any and all obstacles, whether they arise from any source or from any source, at my own expense, and to implement this settlement property for you, your residents, or me and my residents without any hindrance. This Settlement Document is hereby issued in your name, stating that there are no other encumbrances, disputes, guarantees, agreements, mortgages or any other written or verbal acts of any kind whatsoever in respect of the property as per Schedule 9/77 and that the title, survey number, permit and boundaries of the property are correct and indisputable. This property is not an assignment land as per Act No. 9/77. Declaration
I undertake that if the property transferred by this deed does not contain any trees, plantations, precious minerals, mines, granites, machinery, fish ponds, etc., I shall be liable to prosecution and payment of depreciation duty as per law if it is found that there is any such thing as a concealed existence.
/ Tirupati Dharmarantha

Section 22 - BRegistration Act - 1908
Declaration
This declaration is to inform that in the preparation of this document, the details of the property in the document, copies of the 1B deeds of the fields, tax receipts for the places/houses, details of the parties in the document, photos of the parties, details of the property, etc., all the necessary documents have been brought and all of them have been thoroughly examined and included in this document and the document has been prepared. Nothing has been omitted from this document which is to be recorded or recorded. The Scheduled Property has been physically examined, measured and recorded and the deed has been drawn up. We hereby declare that the said property has not been sold to you, nor has any other transaction been made, such as sale, mortgage, etc., to anyone else, that the said property is undisputed, that there are no dues payable on the said property, and that we are/will be able to pay the appropriate stamp duty in the future, as may be found by the authorities (Registration and Stamps Revenue Department) in the inspection of the said property. I/We have not violated the provisions of Section 22-B of the Registration Act, 1908 and I/We shall be solely responsible for all matters relating thereto. I/We have no connection with the Sub-Registrar or the Registrar of Deeds. I/We shall be solely responsible for any and all matters arising out of or relating to the sale of the property by the Government, Endowment, Board of Trustees and Assignees. I/We have read this document and have given my full consent to the same. I/We have read and read this declaration and have read and read it. I/We

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 263 of 2026, dated 29-Jan-2026, executed by Tirupathi Dharmarao in favour of his Wife, Tirupati Jayalaxmi towards the property admeasuring an extent of 72.6 Sq,Yds, located nearby house number 3-67, comprised in survey number 127-1, situated in Tatipaka Village and Gram Panchayat, Rajolu Mandal, within the District of Konaseema, registered at sub-registrar office Mamidikuduru, is bounded as follows: North by: House of Maddula Harish South by: House of Maddula Lakshmi East by: House of Devalla Venkatesh West by: Road

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note : It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the DocumentNumber, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
